10  package de.funfried.netbeans.plugins.external.formatter.ui.editor.diff;
11  
12  import java.io.IOException;
13  import java.io.Reader;
14  import java.util.ArrayList;
15  import java.util.Arrays;
16  import java.util.List;
17  
18  import org.apache.commons.io.IOUtils;
19  import org.netbeans.api.diff.Difference;
20  
21  /**
22   * Implementation based on NetBeans' org.netbeans.modules.diff.builtin.provider.HuntDiff
23   * but without options, it always takes whitespaces into account.
24   *
25   * @author bahlef
26   */
27  public class Diff {
28  	/**
29  	 * Private constructor due to static methods.
30  	 */
31  	private Diff() {
32  	}
33  
34  	/**
35  	 * Read the lines of the given {@link Reader} into a {@link String} array.
36  	 *
37  	 * @param r the {@link Reader}
38  	 *
39  	 * @return a {@link String} array containing each line of the {@link Reader} as a entry of the array
40  	 *
41  	 * @throws IOException if a problem occurs while reading for the given {@link Reader}
42  	 */
43  	private static String[] getLines(Reader r) throws IOException {
44  		List<String> lines = IOUtils.readLines(r);
45  
46  		return lines.toArray(new String[lines.size()]);
47  	}
48  
49  	/**
50  	 * @param r1 {@link Reader} from the first source
51  	 * @param r2 {@link Reader} from the second source
52  	 *
53  	 * @return computed diff
54  	 *
55  	 * @throws IOException if there is an I/O issue with the given {@link Reader}s
56  	 */
57  	public static Difference[] diff(Reader r1, Reader r2) throws IOException {
58  		return diff(getLines(r1), getLines(r2));
59  	}
60  
61  	/**
62  	 * @param lines1 array of lines from the first source
63  	 * @param lines2 array of lines from the second source
64  	 *
65  	 * @return computed diff
66  	 */
67  	public static Difference[] diff(String[] lines1, String[] lines2) {
68  		int[] J = prepareIndex(lines1, lines2);
69  		List<Difference2> differences = getDifferences(J, lines1, lines2);
70  		cleanup(differences);
71  		Difference2[] tempDiffs = differences.toArray(new Difference2[differences.size()]);
72  		Difference[] diffs = new Difference[tempDiffs.length];
73  		for (int i = 0; i < tempDiffs.length; ++i) {
74  			Difference2 tempDiff = tempDiffs[i];
75  			tempDiffs[i] = null;
76  			diffs[i] = new Difference(tempDiff.getType(), tempDiff.getFirstStart(), tempDiff.getFirstEnd(),
77  					tempDiff.getSecondStart(), tempDiff.getSecondEnd(),
78  					tempDiff.getFirstText(), tempDiff.getSecondText());
79  		}
80  		return diffs;
81  	}
82  
83  	private static int[] prepareIndex(String[] lines1, String[] lines2) {
84  		int m = lines1.length;
85  		int n = lines2.length;
86  
87  		Line[] l2s = new Line[n + 1];
88  		// In l2s we have sorted lines of the second file <1, n>
89  		for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++) {
90  			l2s[i] = new Line(i, lines2[i - 1]);
91  		}
92  		Arrays.sort(l2s, 1, n + 1, (Line l1, Line l2) -> l1.line.compareTo(l2.line));
93  
94  		int[] equvalenceLines = new int[n + 1];
95  		boolean[] equivalence = new boolean[n + 1];
96  		for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++) {
97  			Line l = l2s[i];
98  			equvalenceLines[i] = l.lineNo;
99  			equivalence[i] = i == n || !l.line.equals(l2s[i + 1].line);//((Line) l2s.get(i)).line);
100 		}
101 		equvalenceLines[0] = 0;
102 		equivalence[0] = true;
103 		int[] equivalenceAssoc = new int[m + 1];
104 		for (int i = 1; i <= m; i++) {
105 			equivalenceAssoc[i] = findAssoc(lines1[i - 1], l2s, equivalence);
106 		}
107 
108 		Candidate[] K = new Candidate[Math.min(m, n) + 2];
109 		K[0] = new Candidate(0, 0, null);
110 		K[1] = new Candidate(m + 1, n + 1, null);
111 		int k = 0;
112 		for (int i = 1; i <= m; i++) {
113 			if (equivalenceAssoc[i] != 0) {
114 				k = merge(K, k, i, equvalenceLines, equivalence, equivalenceAssoc[i]);
115 			}
116 		}
117 		int[] J = new int[m + 2]; // Initialized with zeros
118 
119 		Candidate c = K[k];
120 		while (c != null) {
121 			J[c.a] = c.b;
122 			c = c.c;
123 		}
124 		return J;
125 	}
126 
127 	private static int findAssoc(String line1, Line[] l2s, boolean[] equivalence) {
128 		int idx = binarySearch(l2s, line1, 1, l2s.length - 1);
129 		if (idx < 1) {
130 			return 0;
131 		} else {
132 			int lastGoodIdx = 0;
133 			for (; idx >= 1 && l2s[idx].line.equals(line1); idx--) {
134 				if (equivalence[idx - 1]) {
135 					lastGoodIdx = idx;
136 				}
137 			}
138 			return lastGoodIdx;
139 		}
140 	}
141 
142 	private static int binarySearch(Line[] L, String key, int low, int high) {
143 		while (low <= high) {
144 			int mid = (low + high) >>> 1;
145 			String midVal = L[mid].line;
146 			int comparison = midVal.compareTo(key);
147 			if (comparison < 0) {
148 				low = mid + 1;
149 			} else if (comparison > 0) {
150 				high = mid - 1;
151 			} else {
152 				return mid;
153 			}
154 		}
155 		return -(low + 1);
156 	}
157 
158 	private static int binarySearch(Candidate[] K, int key, int low, int high) {
159 		while (low <= high) {
160 			int mid = (low + high) >>> 1;
161 			int midVal = K[mid].b;
162 			if (midVal < key) {
163 				low = mid + 1;
164 			} else if (midVal > key) {
165 				high = mid - 1;
166 			} else {
167 				return mid;
168 			}
169 		}
170 		return -(low + 1);
171 	}
172 
173 	private static int merge(Candidate[] K, int k, int i, int[] equvalenceLines,
174 			boolean[] equivalence, int p) {
175 		int r = 0;
176 		Candidate c = K[0];
177 		do {
178 			int j = equvalenceLines[p];
179 			int s = binarySearch(K, j, r, k);
180 			if (s >= 0) {
181 				// j was found in K[]
182 				s = k + 1;
183 			} else {
184 				s = -s - 2;
185 				if (s < r || s > k)
186 					s = k + 1;
187 			}
188 			if (s <= k) {
189 				if (K[s + 1].b > j) {
190 					Candidate newc = new Candidate(i, j, K[s]);
191 					K[r] = c;
192 					r = s + 1;
193 					c = newc;
194 				}
195 				if (s == k) {
196 					K[k + 2] = K[k + 1];
197 					k++;
198 					break;
199 				}
200 			}
201 			if (equivalence[p]) {
202 				break;
203 			} else {
204 				p++;
205 			}
206 		} while (true);
207 		K[r] = c;
208 		return k;
209 	}
210 
211 	private static List<Difference2> getDifferences(int[] J, String[] lines1, String[] lines2) {
212 		List<Difference2> differences = new ArrayList<>();
213 		int n = lines1.length;
214 		int m = lines2.length;
215 		int start1 = 1;
216 		int start2 = 1;
217 		do {
218 			while (start1 <= n && J[start1] == start2) {
219 				start1++;
220 				start2++;
221 			}
222 			if (start1 > n)
223 				break;
224 			if (J[start1] < start2) { // There's something extra in the first file
225 				int end1 = start1 + 1;
226 				List<String> deletedLines = new ArrayList<>();
227 				deletedLines.add(lines1[start1 - 1]);
228 				while (end1 <= n && J[end1] < start2) {
229 					String line = lines1[end1 - 1];
230 					deletedLines.add(line);
231 					end1++;
232 				}
233 				differences.add(new Difference2(Difference.DELETE, start1, end1 - 1, start2 - 1, 0,
234 						deletedLines.toArray(new String[deletedLines.size()]), null));
235 				start1 = end1;
236 			} else { // There's something extra in the second file
237 				int end2 = J[start1];
238 				List<String> addedLines = new ArrayList<>();
239 				for (int i = start2; i < end2; i++) {
240 					String line = lines2[i - 1];
241 					addedLines.add(line);
242 				}
243 				differences.add(new Difference2(Difference.ADD, start1 - 1, 0, start2, end2 - 1,
244 						null, addedLines.toArray(new String[addedLines.size()])));
245 				start2 = end2;
246 			}
247 		} while (start1 <= n);
248 		if (start2 <= m) { // There's something extra at the end of the second file
249 			int end2 = start2 + 1;
250 			List<String> addedLines = new ArrayList<>();
251 			addedLines.add(lines2[start2 - 1]);
252 			while (end2 <= m) {
253 				String line = lines2[end2 - 1];
254 				addedLines.add(line);
255 				end2++;
256 			}
257 			differences.add(new Difference2(Difference.ADD, n, 0, start2, m,
258 					null, addedLines.toArray(new String[addedLines.size()])));
259 		}
260 		return differences;
261 	}
262 
263 	private static void cleanup(List<Difference2> diffs) {
264 		Difference2 last = null;
265 		for (int i = 0; i < diffs.size(); i++) {
266 			Difference2 diff = diffs.get(i);
267 			if (last != null && (diff.getType() == Difference.ADD && last.getType() == Difference.DELETE ||
268 					diff.getType() == Difference.DELETE && last.getType() == Difference.ADD)) {
269 				Difference2 add;
270 				Difference2 del;
271 				if (Difference.ADD == diff.getType()) {
272 					add = diff;
273 					del = last;
274 				} else {
275 					add = last;
276 					del = diff;
277 				}
278 				int d1f1l1 = add.getFirstStart() - (del.getFirstEnd() - del.getFirstStart());
279 				int d2f1l1 = del.getFirstStart();
280 				if (d1f1l1 == d2f1l1) {
281 					Difference2 newDiff = new Difference2(Difference.CHANGE,
282 							d1f1l1, del.getFirstEnd(), add.getSecondStart(), add.getSecondEnd(),
283 							del.getFirstLines(), add.getSecondLines());
284 					diffs.set(i - 1, newDiff);
285 					diffs.remove(i);
286 					i--;
287 					diff = newDiff;
288 				}
289 			}
290 			last = diff;
291 		}
292 	}
293 
294 	private static class Line {
295 		private final int lineNo;
296 
297 		private final String line;
298 
299 		public Line(int lineNo, String line) {
300 			this.lineNo = lineNo;
301 			this.line = line;
302 		}
303 	}
304 
305 	private static class Candidate {
306 		private final int a;
307 
308 		private final int b;
309 
310 		private final Candidate c;
311 
312 		public Candidate(int a, int b, Candidate c) {
313 			this.a = a;
314 			this.b = b;
315 			this.c = c;
316 		}
317 	}
318 
319 	/**
320 	 * An intermediate difference instance sharing left and right content with
321 	 * the original lines to save memory until the real merged content is
322 	 * requested.
323 	 */
324 	private static class Difference2 extends Difference {
325 		private final String[] firstLines;
326 
327 		private final String[] secondLines;
328 
329 		private String leftText;
330 
331 		private String rightText;
332 
333 		public Difference2(int type, int firstStart, int firstEnd, int secondStart, int secondEnd,
334 				String[] lines1, String[] lines2) {
335 			super(type, firstStart, firstEnd, secondStart, secondEnd);
336 			this.firstLines = lines1;
337 			this.secondLines = lines2;
338 		}
339 
340 		public String[] getFirstLines() {
341 			return firstLines;
342 		}
343 
344 		public String[] getSecondLines() {
345 			return secondLines;
346 		}
347 
348 		@Override
349 		public String getFirstText() {
350 			if (leftText == null && firstLines != null) {
351 				leftText = mergeLines(firstLines);
352 			}
353 			return leftText;
354 		}
355 
356 		@Override
357 		public String getSecondText() {
358 			if (rightText == null && secondLines != null) {
359 				rightText = mergeLines(secondLines);
360 			}
361 			return rightText;
362 		}
363 
364 	}
365 
366 	private static String mergeLines(String[] lines) {
367 		int capacity = lines.length; // for newlines
368 		for (String line : lines) {
369 			capacity += line.length();
370 		}
371 		StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(capacity);
372 		for (int i = 0; i < lines.length; ++i) {
373 			String line = lines[i];
374 			lines[i] = null;
375 			sb.append(line).append('\n');
376 		}
377 		return sb.toString();
378 	}
379 }
